page.title: 07Slade Nature Reserve
page.content: Watch is a wildlife organisation for young people.It is the younger version of the Adults'B.B.O.N.T.It aims to save wildlife and plants from becoming extint.Our group started in 1983. The Slade is our nature reserve.It is special as it is the only one in Brit- ain owned by a Watch group.The 3 acre site is divided into a watermeadow,an old railway line and an Alderwood with a stream.All that is left of the old railway line is a long grassy embank- ment.In the future we hope to buy anot- her length of line to add to the reser- ve.In the watermeadow there are Common Spotted Orchids and Ragged Robin both rare plants.On the North Margin there are pollarded willows.Two were danger- ous so had to be cut down.On the South edge is a natural hedge which birds ne- st in.The meadow is cut annually,but we have left a patch uncut as a control.
